elements.content: Neodymium 1D systems: targeting new sources for field-induced slow magnetization relaxation†‡ Amanpreet Kaur Jassal Núria Aliaga-Alcalde Montserrat Corbella Daniel Aravena Eliseo Ruiz and Geeta Hundal 12345678910111213141516(a) L1 bridged paddlewheel dimeric units (green and orange color) further bridged by L1 (blue color), forming linear tapes along the a axis, in 1. (b) [1 0 0] chains of 1 with a 2-connected uninodal net. (c) Ball-n-stick representation showing the coordination environment around NdIII in 2. (d) Acetate bridged ladder along [0 1 0] with L2 bridged zig-zag railing in 2. (e) Helical chain of 2 along the b axis. Terminally bonded ligands are not shown in d and e.

Fig. 1 (a) L1 bridged paddlewheel dimeric units (green and orange color) further bridged by L1 (blue color), forming linear tapes along the a axis, in 1. (b) [1 0 0] chains of 1 with a 2-connected uninodal net. (c) Ball-n-stick representation showing the coordination environment around NdIII in 2. (d) Acetate bridged ladder along [0 1 0] with L2 bridged zig-zag railing in 2. (e) Helical chain of 2 along the b axis. Terminally bonded ligands are not shown in d and e.
